name: The Cliff Town House Hotel and Restaurant

reviews.title: Fabulous Food
reviews.text: We had a fabulous lunch and breakfast at the restaurant. I recommend it highly. You can't get any better.

What a brilliant place for dinner. I was given a tip about this place from a fellow foodie and it did not disappoint. Beautiful setting, delicious food and 3 hours later.... oh my god is that the time. Brilliant!!!!
reviews.title: Brunch excellence
Wedding
reviews.text: Attended a wedding here in march, lovely place for a small/med wedding. food was delicious and the staff were very welcoming. nine rooms upstairs of which i stayed in one which was great. breakfast the following morning was yum too. I am getting married later this year and if i had of known about the cliff house i would have seriously considered it for my own. all in all, highly reccomend.

My boyfriend and I were in the capital for the weekend and decided to head to The Cliff for dinner as I hadn't been able to book a hotel room (it was short notice that we went). The restaurant managed to fit us and made us feel very welcome. We started with cocktails upstairs, in the Aviation bar, with me having a Hendrick's Cosmo and my boyfriend having a dark mojito. We then heading to downstairs again to the beautiful restaurant where the food did not disappoint. I had the smoked salmon and duck, whilst my bf had crab claws and the steak.
reviews.title: Delicious food in a lovely setting
Dined on Recommendation from food expert
reviews.text: I would recommend this restaurant to anyone who wanted a delicious meal in the great setting in the heart of St. Stephen's Green. The bill was on the pricer side, but that is what you expect when the quality is so good. I should also say the staff were friendly, welcoming and happy to help.

Although not usually given to writing restaurant reviews, they are so subjective, I must comment on the exceptional experience and service we encountered at the Cliff Town House, over and above the excellent quality of the food. Arriving very unfashionably early, we’d booked for 5:30 as we were going to a performance at 7:30, but because it was cold and starting to rain we actually turned up just after 5. Expecting to be told, “sorry we aren’t open yet” which would have been perfectly reasonable on a Sunday afternoon when the last stragglers from lunch were just leaving, instead we were welcomed warmly and apologetically, and offered a seat at the bar. The restaurant manager explained that they normally didn’t open till 6 on Sunday but that she had asked the chef to come back on duty a bit earlier because of our booking, but until he arrived would we like to have some oysters, and maybe a glass of sparkling wine or a pint of Guinness?
reviews.title: Exceptional Service and Attitude

reviews.text: We spend a very pleasant half an hour sitting up at the bar, chatting with the expert oyster opener who confessed it was his last day as he was off to join the circus tomorrow, and sampling the different varieties. Meanwhile a table was prepared at the window to catch the last of the spring sunshine across St Stephens Green, the chef duly arrived early and we had a delicious meal, quite possibly the best we had in Ireland, impeccably served and every bit up to the standard of its Michelin starred reputation.
reviews.title: Long lazy great lunch
Excellent meal
reviews.text: When we came to leave, in comfortable time to get to our 7:30 performance, we pointed out that they hadn’t charged us for the pre-prandial drinks and oysters, only to be told that they were complimentary. We were understandably and very pleasantly astounded, as the restaurant had been faultless, we were the ones who arrived well before time and put everyone to some inconvenience. Even without their generosity it would have been a great meal, but overall it was an outstanding dining experience. Certainly when we return to Dublin we will not only eat there again but will stay at the hotel.

We (4) had lunch here today. It was superb. We had the 3 course for 25 € and it was worth every cent. Service was efficient and professional and food was delicious with good choices on menu.We often paid more for far less. We were seated at 2pm and eventually left at 5pm. Will definitely go again.
reviews.title: Bit of a let-down...might give it a 2nd chance

reviews.text: We were a large family group including children celebrating a special occasion. We had booked the €25 lunch menu. Veg is extra. Of course we had bottles of prosecco, costs €36 per bottle.
reviews.title: Cliff House Restaurant Disappoints

reviews.text: While staying at the hotel, we ate 2 dinners at the restaurant. Our meals were delicious. Plenty of choices on the menu. Service was good. The restaurant became very busy later in the evening, so reservations are recommended. They also have a pre-theater menu from 5:30 to 6:30 pm.
reviews.title: Delicious seafood

reviews.text: Went here as part of a large group which had been pre organised to go to the cocktail bar on the top floor. We arrived about 6pm on a Saturday evening and spent a large amount of the time waiting to order! There was one member of staff, who seemed to be training a female who was unable to take orders but very slowly managed to make some cocktails to help him out. With circa 20 people in our group alone and others in the bar in addition to our group - the service was more or less non-existent and ruined what should have been very relaxing pre-meal drinks. The cocktails themselves were really lovely though!
reviews.title: Disappointing experience at cocktail bar

reviews.text: 22 St Stephens Green oozes with charm, class and history. The Cliff House stands on a late 17th century site that was once the home of the Earl of Shelbourne. Marine references within reminds one of its stellar sister and Michelin starred restaurant overlooking the sea down south in Ardmore. The restaurant is a stunning room, lovely and graceful with parquet floors and Georgian sash windows looking out over the exquisite 22 acre St Stephens Green designed by Wm Sheppard and opened to the public in 1880. The food here is outstanding, crab starters are sublime, Dublin Bay Prawn Tempura is classic, in fact all Chef Sean Smiths seafood is as good as it gets. Service is faultless, presentation is creative and the wine list is extensive and well chosen. Breakfast is elegant starting with authentic fruit juice, a proper fruit salad accompanied by West Cork Glenilen yogurt and a lovely selection of eggs cooked with creative style and skill. The full Irish of course is available but I was surprised that an establishment that prides itself on its wonderful seafood has no fish on the breakfast menu.
reviews.title: Coolest address in town
Beautiful Hotel, Perfect Location
reviews.text: We just returned from a wonderful 4 night stay at The Cliff Town House Hotel. It's a perfect mix of comfort along with old Georgian style. The staff is very nice and accommodating, especially Anne, who served our delicious and hearty breakfast each day (included in the price - great deal) and Laura, who helped print out documents and recommended a fantastic Chinese takeout place then gave us plates, utensils and glasses when we needed a break from eating out.

The location can't be beat. Our room on the top floor, #209, had an amazing view of St. Stephen's Green. You're right next to Grafton Street, as well, with tons of restaurants, pubs, and shops. It's one of those hotels that you wake up in and know that you're in Dublin, unlike a room in a major hotel chain. However, along with that, you won't find room service, elevator, etc. but, for us, the tradeoff was worth it. As others have mentioned, be prepared to climb the stairs. It was no issue for us, but perhaps for an older couple the lower floors would be better.
reviews.title: Great staff, wonderful food and magnificent location
Good but lonely
reviews.text: I went there with a colleague for a business lunch on a Thursday. The place was almost empty and with that the atmosphere was a bit... strange. It was just too quiet.

reviews.title: issues with the waiter were forgotten when the food arrived
reviews.text: The service was good but not great. And the food followed the service on that day. It was good but not special.
The restaurant interior is classic and the arrangements are nice.
reviews.title: Treat Yourself
Over-rated and over-hot!
reviews.text: I will go back but there are other places I will visit first

The waiter who took our orders did not seem to understand English which meant that every order had to be repeated and finger pointing at the menu was the only was of being understood. However when the food arrived it was truly excellent so I would recommend and just hope that I did not egt the same waiter
reviews.title: Extremely bad service
